column4: Do you need to add "sudo" before a command when you use root user?
No. Sudo runs stuff as root. If you're at a root terminal, you're already running as root.
What advantages when I use user with the root role instead of user with the admin role?
Running as a user with admin powers is better, because then you only "power up" to root for specific tasks, so it's less likely that errant software will fraggle your whole system.
